benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Upload the full catalog as XML

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios with required and optional headers verify 201 Created, confirmation body, and Location header (e.g., TC01–TC05, TC11, TC13, TC24, TC27–TC30).
Invalid Payload: Malformed/partial/whitespace-only XML and empty body return 400 (TC08, TC09, TC18, TC23).
Header Validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing/empty handled (TC01–TC03, TC06, TC07); optional headers covered (present/absent) (TC02, TC03).
Content-Type Validation: Unsupported media type rejected (TC10).
Duplicate Submission: Duplicate catalog version behavior considered (TC25).
Large Payloads: Very large but well-formed XML covered (TC12).
Server Unavailability: 503 when backend is down (TC16).
Response Semantics: Presence of Location header and confirmation string/URI validated in success paths (TC01, TC02).
Encodings and Special Characters: UTF-8/UTF-16, unicode, comments, CDATA covered (TC24, TC28, TC29).
Boundary Values: XML boundary conditions tested (TC30).
Performance/Concurrency: Normal and concurrent load scenarios (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Response content negotiation is not validated: tests do not assert response Content-Type (text/plain or application/json) or that the body schema is a string per story.
Positive assertion that Content-Type: text/xml is required/accepted in success paths is missing; only the negative case (unsupported media type) is tested.
No Accept header tests to verify server returns a representation aligned with Accept (e.g., application/json vs text/plain).
Server Error Handling: No scenario for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB exception, parser crash) as per POST guidelines.
Status code accuracy: Unsupported media type should typically be 415 (tests expect 400); oversized payloads should return 413 Payload Too Large (TC12 uses 201 or 400).
Location header quality not verified: format, absolute/relative correctness, and that the Location can be dereferenced to the new resource.
Idempotency/duplicate replay behavior not concretely tested (same payload retried quickly); deterministic expectation for second submission not defined.
Optional headers validation when present but empty or extreme length not covered (e.g., empty X-Killbill-Reason/Comment, very long header values, whitespace-only CreatedBy).

XML semantic/business validation (well-formed but invalid per catalog schema/business rules) not distinguished from syntactic malformation (e.g., missing required catalog fields should yield 400/422).
TC29 combines two flows in one scenario, which reduces clarity and atomicity of results.
recommendations: Add scenarios to verify response Content-Type and schema: When Accept: application/json, respond with JSON confirmation; when Accept: text/plain (or default), respond with plain text; assert body is a string per spec.
Add a positive success scenario that explicitly sets Content-Type: text/xml; assert success and response headers.
Introduce Accept header matrix tests: Accept: application/json and Accept: text/plain, plus unacceptable Accept leading to 406 if applicable.
Add server error handling tests that simulate a DB failure or unexpected exception returning 500; ensure error payload format is validated.
Refine status codes: expect 415 for unsupported media type; define and test payload size limit with 413 for oversized XML.
Enhance Location header checks: validate URL format and perform a follow-up GET/HEAD to ensure the resource is retrievable.

Add idempotency/duplicate replay test: submit the exact same valid XML twice rapidly; assert the second returns a deterministic result (e.g., 409 Conflict or 201 with same version and no duplicate state).

Expand header validation: whitespace-only CreatedBy rejected; extremely long or non-ASCII header values; empty X-Killbill-Reason/Comment should be accepted or rejected per spec; add length constraints where applicable.
Add XML semantic validation scenarios: well-formed but schema-invalid catalog (e.g., missing product, invalid price range) should return 400/422 with clear messages.
Split TC29 into two separate scenarios (UTF-8 and UTF-16) for clarity and independent pass/fail reporting.
Make expectations deterministic: avoid “201 or 400/409” in assertions; align with the API contract and update tests accordingly.
